Package shaharas

Interface Operators

All Known Implementing Classes:
Add, AddEQL, AddOneLeft, AddOneRight, BaseBinaryOperators, BaseOperators, BaseUnaryOperators, CloseParen, Div, DivEQL, Equals, Mul, MulEQL, OpenParen, Sub, SubEQL, SubOneLeft, SubOneRight
public interface Operators
The Operators interface defines the contract for all operator classes in the program. It represents an operator in an expression, providing methods to manipulate its state and perform calculations. Each operator class that implements this interface will define its behavior for operations such as calculation, setting values, copying (cloning), and retrieving operator details like regex pattern, priority, and symbol.

  • Method Details

    • setA

      Operators setA(int a)
      Sets the operand (value) for the operator. This method allows setting the value of the operatorג€™s operand, which may be used in a calculation.
      Parameters:
      a - the value to set for the operator
      Returns:
      the current instance of the operator with the updated value

    • calculate

      int calculate(String variable, int... args)
      Calculates the result of applying the operator to the given arguments. This method performs the operation represented by the operator on the provided arguments. If the operator requires multiple operands, they will be provided in the varargs parameter.
      Parameters:
      variable - the variable name used in the expression (can be ignored for some operators)
      args - the operands for the operator, passed as a variable number of integer arguments
      Returns:
      the result of the operation

    • clone

      Operators clone()
      Creates a copy (clone) of the current operator. This method allows the operator to be duplicated, preserving its current state.
      Returns:
      a new instance of the operator, identical to the current one

    • getRegex

      Pattern getRegex()
      Retrieves the regex pattern associated with the operator. Each operator is typically represented by a regular expression, which can be used for matching operator symbols in the input expression. This method returns the regex pattern that represents the operator.
      Returns:
      the regex pattern for the operator

    • getPriority

      int getPriority()
      Retrieves the priority of the operator. The priority defines the precedence of the operator in expressions. Operators with higher priority are evaluated first. For example, multiplication (*) and division (/) have higher priority than addition (+) and subtraction (-).
      Returns:
      the priority of the operator, where higher numbers indicate higher precedence

    • getSymbol

      String getSymbol()
      Retrieves the symbol of the operator. The symbol represents the operator in string format (e.g., "+" for addition, "-" for subtraction).
      Returns:
      the string symbol of the operator
